articles.title: Number of coronavirus cases soars to over 40,000 in China
articles.description: Extreme measures are being taken to contain the virus, with disinfectant being sprayed on buildings and cars in Wuhan, and masks and anxiety becoming the new norm in Beijing.

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: As some prepare to leave quarantine, workers on air force base face harassment
articles.description: Officials sent letters to residents of Riverside County on Monday, urging people to stop targeting base employees with “hurtful” statements online or in person.
articles.content:
As the first group of Americans evacuated from China prepares to leave quarantine at the March Air Reserve Base in California, those who work on the base have faced public harassment stemming from unnecessary fear of the coronavirus.

articles.author: Martha C. White
articles.title: From idled car production to iPhone delays, China's factory closures mean pain for U.S. companies
articles.description: As the coronavirus continues to spread in China, manufacturing gridlock has America's corporate leaders scrambling to find alternative sources — but may not be fast enough to prevent a slowdown in their business.
articles.content: In an attempt to get the fast-spreading coronavirus epidemic under control, Chinese authorities in some parts of the country reportedly have told factories to remain shuttered for as long as three more weeks. The prospect of extended manufacturing gridlock ha… [+4936 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Wuhan city requisitions hotels, gyms in fight against coronavirus
articles.description: The Chinese city at the center of the international coronavirus emergency has mobilized 34,000 health workers to check on the health of its entire population.

articles.author: Elizabeth Chuck
articles.title: Many miscarriages are still a mystery. A new test could give women faster answers.
articles.description: Fetal genetic testing can take weeks and costs thousands of dollars, leaving patients in limbo after a pregnancy loss. Dr. Zev Williams invented a new method of rapid genetic testing that will cost under $200.
articles.content: Sherisa Rivera and her husband, Will Rivera II, will never forget the first and only time they saw their babys heartbeat on an ultrasound. After two unexplained miscarriages, the flutter on the screen at Sherisas obstetricians office about seven weeks into he… [+10075 chars]

articles.title: South Koreans celebrate big wins for 'Parasite' at the Oscars
articles.description: South Koreans celebrated "Parasite" and its success at the Academy Awards, as President Moon Jae-in started a staff meeting with a round of applause.
articles.content:

articles.title: Coronavirus: Volunteers rush to help pets trapped in locked-down Wuhan
articles.description: Volunteers in Wuhan say thousands of pets are potentially trapped inside homes in Wuhan after the city went into lockdown amid coronavirus epidemic.
articles.content:
They may have escaped Wuhan the Chinese city at the epicenter of the coronavirus epidemic but many left without their pets and almost two weeks on, they fear for their animals which have been left without food and water.
